verses.verse: When a <S%H376>man<s%> hath <S%H3947>taken<s%> a <S%H802>wife<s%>, and <S%H1166>married<s%> her, and it come to pass that she <S%H4672>find<s%> no <S%H2580>favour<s%> in his <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, because he hath <S%H4672>found<s%> <S%H1697>some<s%> <S%H6172>uncleanness<s%> in her: then let him <S%H3789>write<s%> her a <S%H5612>bill<s%> of <S%H3748>divorcement<s%>, and <S%H5414>give<s%> it in her <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and <S%H7971>send<s%> her out of his <S%H1004>house<s%>. some: Heb. matter of nakedness divorcement: Heb. cutting off
And when she is departed <S%H3318>out<s%> of his <S%H1004>house<s%>, she may <S%H1980>go<s%> and be <S%H312>another<s%> <S%H376>man's<s%> wife.

And if the <S%H314>latter<s%> <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H8130>hate<s%> her, and <S%H3789>write<s%> her a <S%H5612>bill<s%> of <S%H3748>divorcement<s%>, and <S%H5414>giveth<s%> it in her <S%H3027>hand<s%>, and <S%H7971>sendeth<s%> her out of his <S%H1004>house<s%>; or if the <S%H314>latter<s%> <S%H376>husband<s%> <S%H4191>die<s%>, which <S%H3947>took<s%> her to be his <S%H802>wife<s%>;

Her <S%H7223>former<s%> <S%H1167>husband<s%>, which sent her <S%H7971>away<s%>, <S%H3201>may<s%> not <S%H3947>take<s%> her <S%H7725>again<s%> to be his <S%H802>wife<s%>, <S%H310>after<s%> that she is <S%H2930>defiled<s%>; for that is <S%H8441>abomination<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: and thou shalt not cause the <S%H776>land<s%> to <S%H2398>sin<s%>, which the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%>.

When a <S%H376>man<s%> hath <S%H3947>taken<s%> a <S%H2319>new<s%> <S%H802>wife<s%>, he shall not go <S%H3318>out<s%> to <S%H6635>war<s%>, neither shall he be <S%H5674>charged<s%> with any <S%H1697>business<s%>: but he shall be <S%H5355>free<s%> at <S%H1004>home<s%> <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%>, and shall cheer <S%H8055>up<s%> his <S%H802>wife<s%> which he hath <S%H3947>taken<s%>. neither: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him
No man shall <S%H2254>take<s%> the <S%H7347>nether<s%> or the upper <S%H7393>millstone<s%> to <S%H2254>pledge<s%>: for he <S%H2254>taketh<s%> a man's <S%H5315>life<s%> to <S%H2254>pledge<s%>.

If a <S%H376>man<s%> be <S%H4672>found<s%> <S%H1589>stealing<s%> <S%H5315>any<s%> of his <S%H251>brethren<s%> of the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, and maketh <S%H6014>merchandise<s%> of him, or <S%H4376>selleth<s%> him; then that <S%H1590>thief<s%> shall <S%H4191>die<s%>; and thou shalt <S%H1197>put<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H1197>away<s%> from <S%H7130>among<s%> you.

Take <S%H8104>heed<s%> in the <S%H5061>plague<s%> of <S%H6883>leprosy<s%>, that thou <S%H8104>observe<s%> <S%H3966>diligently<s%>, and <S%H6213>do<s%> according to all that the <S%H3548>priests<s%> the <S%H3881>Levites<s%> shall <S%H3384>teach<s%> you: as I <S%H6680>commanded<s%> them, so ye shall <S%H8104>observe<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%>.

<S%H2142>Remember<s%> what the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H6213>did<s%> unto <S%H4813>Miriam<s%> by the <S%H1870>way<s%>, after that ye were come <S%H3318>forth<s%> out of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>.

When thou dost <S%H5383>lend<s%> thy <S%H7453>brother<s%> <S%H3972>any<s%> <S%H4859>thing<s%>, thou shalt not <S%H935>go<s%> into his <S%H1004>house<s%> to <S%H5670>fetch<s%> his <S%H5667>pledge<s%>. lend: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc
Thou shalt <S%H5975>stand<s%> <S%H2351>abroad<s%>, and the <S%H376>man<s%> to whom thou dost <S%H5383>lend<s%> shall bring <S%H3318>out<s%> the <S%H5667>pledge<s%> <S%H2351>abroad<s%> unto thee.
And if the <S%H376>man<s%> be <S%H6041>poor<s%>, thou shalt not <S%H7901>sleep<s%> with his <S%H5667>pledge<s%>:

In any <S%H7725>case<s%> thou shalt <S%H7725>deliver<s%> him the <S%H5667>pledge<s%> <S%H7725>again<s%> when the <S%H8121>sun<s%> goeth <S%H935>down<s%>, that he may <S%H7901>sleep<s%> in his own <S%H8008>raiment<s%>, and <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee: and it shall be <S%H6666>righteousness<s%> unto thee <S%H6440>before<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>.

Thou shalt not <S%H6231>oppress<s%> an hired <S%H7916>servant<s%> that is <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%>, whether he be of thy <S%H251>brethren<s%>, or of thy <S%H1616>strangers<s%> that are in thy <S%H776>land<s%> within thy <S%H8179>gates<s%>:

At his <S%H3117>day<s%> thou shalt <S%H5414>give<s%> him his <S%H7939>hire<s%>, neither shall the <S%H8121>sun<s%> go <S%H935>down<s%> upon it; for he is <S%H6041>poor<s%>, and <S%H5375>setteth<s%> his <S%H5315>heart<s%> upon it: lest he <S%H7121>cry<s%> against thee unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and it be <S%H2399>sin<s%> unto thee. setteth: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it

The <S%H1>fathers<s%> shall not be put to <S%H4191>death<s%> for the <S%H1121>children<s%>, neither shall the <S%H1121>children<s%> be put to <S%H4191>death<s%> for the <S%H1>fathers<s%>: every <S%H376>man<s%> shall be put to <S%H4191>death<s%> for his own <S%H2399>sin<s%>.

Thou shalt not <S%H5186>pervert<s%> the <S%H4941>judgment<s%> of the <S%H1616>stranger<s%>, nor of the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>; nor <S%H2254>take<s%> a <S%H490>widow's<s%> <S%H899>raiment<s%> to <S%H2254>pledge<s%>:

But thou shalt <S%H2142>remember<s%> that thou wast a <S%H5650>bondman<s%> in <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> thee thence: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee to <S%H6213>do<s%> this <S%H1697>thing<s%>.

When thou cuttest <S%H7114>down<s%> thine <S%H7105>harvest<s%> in thy <S%H7704>field<s%>, and hast <S%H7911>forgot<s%> a <S%H6016>sheaf<s%> in the <S%H7704>field<s%>, thou shalt not go <S%H7725>again<s%> to <S%H3947>fetch<s%> it: it shall be for the <S%H1616>stranger<s%>, for the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, and for the <S%H490>widow<s%>: that the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> may <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in all the <S%H4639>work<s%> of thine <S%H3027>hands<s%>.

When thou <S%H2251>beatest<s%> thine olive <S%H2132>tree<s%>, thou shalt not go over the <S%H6286>boughs<s%> <S%H310>again<s%>: it shall be for the <S%H1616>stranger<s%>, for the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, and for the <S%H490>widow<s%>. go: Heb. bough it after thee

When thou <S%H1219>gatherest<s%> the grapes of thy <S%H3754>vineyard<s%>, thou shalt not <S%H5953>glean<s%> it <S%H310>afterward<s%>: it shall be for the <S%H1616>stranger<s%>, for the <S%H3490>fatherless<s%>, and for the <S%H490>widow<s%>. afterward: Heb. after thee

And thou shalt <S%H2142>remember<s%> that thou wast a <S%H5650>bondman<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee to <S%H6213>do<s%> this <S%H1697>thing<s%>.
